translation.text: Train #2112, scheduled to depart Fox Lake at 6:34am, will not operate due to yesterday's derailment.  Train #2116 will accommodate the Customers.
Milwaukee North   2118 scheduled to arrive Chicago at 8:30a.m. and 2120  scheduled to arrive Chicago at 8:37 a.m. will terminate at Western Ave. due to yesterday derailment at Chicago Union Station.
Union Pacific Northwest Line passengers, Train 636, scheduled to arrive Chicago at 8:46 a.m., will board from Platform 2 at Palatine, Arlington Park, Arlington Heights, Mount Prospect and Cumberland.
The Homewood platform elevator is out of service. Alternate accessible stations are Calumet or Flossmoor.
Train #2218, scheduled to depart Franklin Park at 7:46am, will not operate due to yesterday's derailment,  Train #2226 will accommodate the Customers.
Train #2403, scheduled to depart Chicago at 6:55am, will not operate due to yesterday's derailment.  Train #2205 will accommodate the Customers.
NCS train 108 scheduled to arrive in Chicago at 8:03 am, is delayed 15 to 25 minutes due to signal problems.
Metra Alert ME - Homewood East Side Construction Will Begin March 13

Beginning Monday, March 13, access to the Homewood Station from the east will be closed for station construction until Summer 2024.  Access to the boarding platform will be through the Park Avenue entrance ONLY (west side of tracks).

 

Beginning, Monday, March 6, the Pace bus stop will relocate from Harwood Avenue to Park Avenue.  Please allow additional time and use caution near the work zone.
Metra Alert RI - Construction begins April 21 at 103rd Street Washington Heights Station.
Metra forces will begin work Friday, April 21 on a major rehab project at the 103rd Street/Washington Heights Station on the Rock Island Line, for more informaiton click here.
Metra Alert MD-N - Milwaukee West/North and North Central Service trains may incur delays and operational changes during morning rush hour

Milwaukee West, Milwaukee North, and North Central Service trains may incur delays and operational changes during the morning rush hours Monday, May 8th due to an Amtrak train derailment that took place Sunday afternoon. At this time, it is anticipated that some trains will not operate. Milwaukee West train #2218 will not operate and North Central Service train #110 will accommodate passengers at River Grove, #2403 will not operate and #2205 will accommodate pasengers, and Milwaukee North train #2112 will not operate and #2116 will accommodate passengers. Projected operational changes taking place for those traveling inbound include passengers detraining at Western Avenue then boarding another train to arrive downtown Chicago. Please listen to platform and station announcements for delay times, operational changes, and cancellations. Check track gateboards prior to boarding your train and seek assistance from Metra personnel if you have any questions. As an alternate means of travel, passengers can use the Union Pacific West and Union Pacific North lines. Passengers should head out earlier than normal when traveling until this issue is resolved. Metra will provide updated information as it becomes available.
